title: Mississippi Pot Roast Recipe
description: Mississippi pot roast is easy to make in a slow cooker with a chuck roast, au jus gravy, and pepperoncini peppers for fork-tender, flavorsome results.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Beef Pot Roast Recipes Mississippi Pot Roast 4.7 (528) 451 Reviews 39 Photos Mississippi pot roast is the perfect dish to make in the slow cooker with a chuck roast, gravy, and pepperoncini peppers. The tender, tangy shredded beef is delicious with mashed potatoes or piled into hoagie rolls. Submitted by JennCrippen Updated on October 11, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 39 39 39 39 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 5 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This easy Mississippi pot roast recipe is a shortcut dinner that never fails to please everyone at your table. What Is Mississippi Pot Roast? Mississippi pot roast is pot roast flavored with dressing mix and cooked in the slow cooker. This method results in a wonderfully tender and juicy pot roast that's shockingly easy to make. Mississippi Pot Roast Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated Mississippi pot roast recipe: · Chuck roast: This Mississippi pot roast starts with one 3-pound chuck roast. If your roast is larger or smaller, adjust the recipe.· Pepperoncini: You'll use both the juice and the peppers from a pepperoncini jar.· Butter: A stick of butter locks in moisture and keeps the roast from drying out.· Packaged mixes: Use one packet of au jus gravy mix and one packet of buttermilk ranch dressing mix.· Seasonings: Simply season the roast with salt and pepper. Allrecipes How to Make Mississippi Pot Roast You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make Mississippi pot roast: Simply combine all the ingredients in a slow cooker and cook on Low until the meat is fork-tender. That's it! How to Serve Mississippi Pot Roast Serve your Mississippi pot roast with gravy and mashed potatoes for a wonderfully satisfying meal. Of course, crusty bread to soak up the gravy is never a bad idea. How to Store Mississippi Pot Roast Allow the leftover roast to cool, then wrap it tightly in foil or place it in an airtight container. Store it in the refrigerator for up to three days. You can freeze the leftovers for up to two months. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Absolutely flavorful," raves Susan Komorowski. "Served on toasted ciabatta rolls with havarti cheese! Amazing! Love this recipe!" "We love it," says one Allrecipes community member. "I have made it several times and it's the most tender and flavorful roast I believe I have ever had!" "I made it just as the recipe stated but added a little red wine," according to another Allrecipes community member. "We had it the first night with mashed potatoes and it was fabulous. The next day we had the leftovers on toasted steak rolls a la Italian beef sandwiches." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (3 pound) chuck roast ½ (12 ounce) jar pepperoncini ½ (12 ounce) jar pepperoncini juice ½ cup unsalted butter 1 (1 ounce) packet au jus gravy mix 1 (0.4 oz) package buttermilk ranch dressing mix salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Combine chuck roast, pepperoncini, pepperoncini juice, butter, au jus mix, ranch dressing mix, salt, and pepper in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low until roast is fork-tender, about 8 hours. Remove chuck from slow cooker; shred with 2 forks and serve with gravy. JennCrippen I Made It Print 970 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Mississippi Pot Roast 01 of 39 Photo by  JennCrippen 02 of 39 Photo by  lutzflcat 06/10/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite Have had this recipe saved for a long time, and I have to ask myself why have I waited so long to make this? In a word, it’s fabulous! The only change I made was cutting the butter in half. I did add some slivers of garlic into the meat, cooked all day in the slow cooker on low, and the meat was just falling apart, fork tender. Such an unusual combination of ingredients that really work. Made a cornstarch slurry for some gravy and served over noodles. Leftovers were enjoyed on toasted Kaiser rolls. Can’t say enough good things about this roast, thoroughly enjoyed. 03 of 39 Photo by  DREGINEK 01/31/2024 I have either made this recipe (and forgot to save/review) or a very similar version of it also from this site. Either way - it’s been a while since I made this or similar equivalent- so pulled it out. This is just a darn good recipe! Whether served over mashed potatoes or egg noodles or even sliced/shredded for roast beef sandwiches! Simple! Delicious! Minimal ingredients! Win, win, win! I made using a venison roast which, this method and ingredients just jazzes it up so well, you would hardly know it’s venison! Highly recommend for a down home good meal. Thanks JennCrippen! 04 of 39 Photo by  RowdyNut4997 03/20/2023 Added potatoes and carrots. Tangy with Little kick. SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD 05 of 39 Photo by  lynn 03/15/2023 Excellent! This is better than regular pot roast....the tang from the peperoncinis is just right! We preferred the "gravy" to be thinner - more like au jus....and went light on it. A winner for sure! 06 of 39 Photo by  SandyCod3805 01/02/2023 This was so good! So much flavor! I had mine without bread, but my husband put his on a hoagie with provolone and was obsessed. 07 of 39 Photo by  DapperStir5383 01/02/2023 Was not so sure about this one…..but took the chance and made it… my house smelled amazing all day…it was easy… and when it was done it was delicious….will make it again for sure…. And my neighbors will be happy…. As they got the leftovers)! 08 of 39 Photo by  bizzarro 08/24/2022 This pot roast is amazing.Only thing I did different was added mushrooms and a little more beef stock because we love gravies.Loved it! 09 of 39 Photo by  Christopher M Cozby 04/23/2021 10 of 39 Photo by  RICO 01/25/2021 Easy And A Good Recip 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Mississippi Roast (Slow Cooker Pepperoncini Pot Roast) 433 Ratings Instant Pot Yankee Pot Roast 9 Ratings Stovetop Yankee Pot Roast 68 Ratings Cranberry Pot Roast by Michelle 17 Ratings Stove Pot Roast With Mashed Potatoes 10 Ratings Baja Pot Roast 25 Ratings Easiest Pot Roast Ever 575 Ratings Easy Pressure Cooker Pot Roast 258 Ratings Healthier (but still awesome) Awesome Slow Cooker Pot Roast 36 Ratings Irish Stout Beer Pot Roast 37 Ratings Red Pot Roast 38 Ratings Pot Roast with Vegetables 157 Ratings Instant Pot Pot Roast 81 Ratings Asian Pot Roast in an Instant Pot 14 Ratings Instant Pot 'Pot Roast' 6 Ratings Pot Roast, Vegetables, and Beer 113 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JennCrippen
instructions: Combine chuck roast, pepperoncini, pepperoncini juice, butter, au jus mix, ranch dressing mix, salt, and pepper in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low until roast is fork-tender, about 8 hours.;Remove chuck from slow cooker; shred with 2 forks and serve with gravy. JennCrippen
